decks.notes: The main concept of this Aggro - Death and Taxes deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Ephemerate, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Aven Interrupter and Overlord of the Balemurk. Utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and gaining card advantage with Recruiter of the Guard. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent land drops.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo of creatures and spells without relying on lands. Utilizing cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Thundertrap Trainer, the goal is to quickly generate mana and control the board until you can cast powerful spells like Whir of Invention and Suppression Ray. By carefully managing resources and countering opponent's threats, the deck aims to win the game using cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Beyeen Veil to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly generate mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility with its ability to shutdown opponent's artifacts. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large Eldrazi threats while controlling the game with various spells and abilities.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Master of the Pearl Trident and Lord of Atlantis to boost the power of Merfolk creatures and using cards like Merfolk Trickster to disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to control the tempo of the game and close out matches quickly. A mix of creature buffs, disruptive abilities, and card draw options ensure that this deck can adapt to different situations and maintain its aggressive strategy throughout the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures supported by burn spells and removal to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of creatures on the board while using burn spells and removal to clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes cards that provide additional utility and flexibility, such as Goblin Bombardment for extra reach and Static Prison for control over the opponent's actions. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck while maximizing consistency and speed.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to create a powerful combo loop that allows the player to continuously mill their own deck and set up for a win condition with cards like Thassa's Oracle or Grapeshot. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble provide additional card draw and fuel for the combo, while Urza's Saga helps tutor for essential pieces. The deck also includes disruption and protection with cards like Soul-Guide Lantern, Swan Song, and Unholy Heat to ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures and spells to win without relying on lands. By creating a synergy between cards like Goblin Charbelcher, Lotus Bloom, and Disrupting Shoal, players can quickly assemble a powerful combo to defeat their opponent. The deck also includes various control elements like Jwari Disruption and Flare of Denial to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while utilizing cards like Sink into Stupor and Consign to Memory for additional removal and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents with its unique landless combo strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's resources and controlling the board while applying pressure with efficient and aggressive creatures. It aims to lock down opponent's key pieces with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Flickerwisp, while utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Ephemerate to deal with threats. With a mix of removal, disruption, and powerful creatures like Ketramose and Phelia, the deck looks to grind out victories by outvaluing the opponent and keeping them on the back foot.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with varying colors to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It includes a mix of creatures with different abilities and spells to control the board and protect your threats. The deck also includes Leylines to provide additional benefits and consistency. The mana base is designed to support the multiple colors of the deck, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game through a combination of creature aggression and spell disruption.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It combines low-costed creatures with powerful synergies to quickly build a board presence and deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos help to generate value and provide additional utility. The deck also incorporates a mix of removal spells and disruptive elements to control the board while maintaining pressure. This Boros Aggro deck is designed to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student as key pieces for card advantage and recursion. Grinding Station is used to mill both players' decks, while Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal provide additional card draw and mana ramp. The deck also includes disruption elements like Pithing Needle and Lightning Bolt, as well as win conditions like Thassa's Oracle and Malevolent Rumble. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts, making the deck a powerful and consistent combo strategy.

The deck revolves around using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to recur artifacts from the graveyard, while utilizing Underworld Breach to continually cast spells from the graveyard. The ultimate goal is to assemble the Combo pieces like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to generate infinite mill or damage, ultimately winning the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck's mana base is designed to support the Combo pieces and ensure consistency in executing the Combo.

This deck revolves around assembling key pieces such as Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Underworld Breach to create a powerful combo engine. By using Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to mill cards and generate mana, the deck aims to loop spells and artifacts from the graveyard with Underworld Breach to generate infinite mana and spells to finish off the opponent with Malevolent Rumble or Grapeshot. The deck also runs disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Swan Song to protect the combo and control the board, while cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble provide additional value and consistency.

This deck focuses on using a combination of counter spells, hand disruption, and removal to control the game while gradually building up threats with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to ensure that the right answers are always available. The mana base is designed to support the deck's spells and abilities, with a good mix of fetch lands and dual lands to provide consistency. Overall, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory through inevitable advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish board control and disrupt your opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to utilize cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to abuse powerful enters-the-battlefield triggers, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to slow down your opponent. The deck also incorporates graveyard hate with Relic of Progenitus and efficient removal with Solitude. By combining aggression with disruption, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing mana ramp and card draw to quickly and efficiently cast spells, leading to a potent combo finish using Grapehot or Gifts Ungiven. The goal is to cast as many spells in a single turn to deal massive damage to the opponent or find key combo pieces. The deck also includes cards for card advantage and graveyard recursion, ensuring that the combo can be executed consistently. The lands in the deck also support the mana requirements of the spells and provide flexibility in casting them.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key concept revolves around utilizing a diverse array of creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent and control the battlefield. The deck also incorporates Leylines to provide additional support and protection for your creatures. The mana base is structured to provide consistent access to different colors of mana to support the diverse card requirements of the deck. This balanced approach aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Primeval Titan, and Amulet of Vigor to power out combo pieces like Scapeshift. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor, the deck can untap its lands multiple times in a turn to generate a huge amount of mana and potentially win the game with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. The deck also incorporates multiple land tutors like Expedition Map and Tolaria West to assemble the combo pieces efficiently. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a massive amount of damage from Valakut triggers.

The deck revolves around playing aggressive creatures and supporting spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It focuses on a mix of fast creatures like Ragavan and Ranger-Captain of Eos, along with powerful combat tricks and removal spells to control the board. The mana base is designed to support the fast-paced nature of the deck, with a mix of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the colors needed for spells. Overall, the Boros Aggro deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain that pressure throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach in combination with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Grinding Station to create a powerful combo engine that can quickly mill through the deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. It also includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Mox Opal to help filter through the deck and generate mana for the combo. The deck aims to set up its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces that allow you to repeatedly play cards from your graveyard using Underworld Breach in order to mill your opponent out or win with Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card selection and recursion, while Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble provide additional combo pieces. The deck also includes various mana rocks like Mox Opal and Mox Amber to ramp into the combo faster, along with some disruptive spells like Spell Snare and Unholy Heat for protection.

The deck focuses on applying early pressure through aggressive creatures while disrupting opponents with a combination of hand disruption and removal spells. It also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Ephemerate to maximize value from enter-the-battlefield abilities. The deck aims to control the board and slow down opponents' game plan while quickly building up a board presence to overwhelm them. The key strategy is to efficiently use resources and disrupt opponents while applying pressure to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to prevent the opponent from gaining momentum while using cards like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with threats. Additionally, cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and further disrupt the opponent's plans. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and outlast the opponent through resource management and disruption.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return provide board control while Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn generate additional threats. The deck combines ramp and control elements to overwhelm opponents with massive Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan.

This Esper Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with a mix of removal spells, counter magic, and graveyard hate. It aims to control the board and limit the opponent's resources while gradually gaining card advantage and overwhelming them with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Ketramose, the New Dawn. The deck also utilizes cards like Relic of Progenitus and Psychic Frog to manipulate graveyard interactions and further disrupt opponent's plans. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

This deck aims to quickly get powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach. By discarding big creatures like Emrakul or Ulamog with Faithless Looting, the deck can cheat them into play for a game-ending swing. Thoughtseize helps control the opponent's hand while cards like Yggdrasil and Kozilek's Command provide additional value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats that can end the game in just a few turns.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while also applying early pressure with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf. The deck also utilizes removal spells such as Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. Additionally, cards like Wrenn and Six provide value through recursion and card advantage. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by overwhelming the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and disruption spells.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt opponents while putting pressure on them. It uses powerful creatures like Elesh Norn and Emperor of Bones, along with disruption like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It also includes cards that can flicker creatures for extra value and graveyard hate to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to control the opponent's board while constantly applying pressure to win the game quickly. With a mix of disruptive elements and aggressive creatures, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent. It utilizes a mixture of removal, graveyard hate, and creature recursion to keep the opponent on their back foot while steadily building towards a powerful finish. With a combination of powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Solitude, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, ensuring victory through tempo advantage and creature synergy.

This deck revolves around using Ral, Monsoon Mage and various cheap spells like Desperate Ritual, Manamorphose, and Pyretic Ritual to generate mana and storm count. The goal is to chain together spells to eventually cast Grapeshot or Past in Flames for a game-ending combo. Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse help with card selection and drawing into combo pieces. With the help of cards like Valakut Awakening and Wish, the deck can dig for key pieces while utilizing Wrenn's Resolve and Artist's Talent for protection and additional card advantage. The mana base includes fetch lands for consistency and some lands that provide additional utility.

The deck focuses on quickly milling the opponent's library using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Fractured Sanity. This is supplemented by removal spells like Fatal Push and counterspells like Spell Snare to protect the combo pieces. Surgical Extraction helps to disrupt the opponent's strategies, while Tasha's Hideous Laughter can mill a large portion of their library at once. The deck also includes card draw with Visions of Beyond and Glimpse the Unthinkable, as well as a Planeswalker in Jace, the Perfected Mind for additional control. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Shelldock Isle.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents through counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers like Teferi. By controlling the board and limiting the opponent's resources, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game. The inclusion of companions like Kaheera adds an extra layer of synergy to the deck, providing additional support and value. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and the ability to cast spells of different colors. Overall, the deck excels at controlling the game and grinding out victories through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards that boost the power of multi-color creatures and maximize the effectiveness of Leyline synergies. The mana base is built around fetching different types of lands to support the diverse color requirements of the cards in the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast-paced aggression and efficient removal to overpower the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes a mix of multi-colored creatures and spells to create a fast-paced and powerful aggro strategy. The deck also includes Leylines to protect against targeted removal and enhance creature abilities. With a mix of creatures with high power and toughness, along with efficient burn spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and close out the game before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and quickly dealing damage to the opponent. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. The deck also includes control elements like Stubborn Denial and Spell Snare to protect its creatures and ensure a smooth path to victory. Additionally, cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide support for the creatures in the deck, allowing them to make a bigger impact on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures with a mix of different colors to maximize damage output. It includes cards that provide additional benefits when dealing damage, as well as spells to control the opponent's board and protect your own creatures. The key strategy is to quickly establish a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently while controlling the opponent's resources. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the creatures and spells in the deck.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. The creatures in the deck have low mana costs and the burn spells can either target creatures or the opponent directly. The deck also includes some control elements with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to finish off the opponent quickly by overwhelming them with creatures and burn spells while maintaining control of the board.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence by playing efficient creatures and utilizing impactful spells to deal damage and control the opponent's board. It aims to be aggressive and disruptive, using cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment adds an element of control to the deck, allowing it to handle different types of threats. The mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing and access to the required colors for the spells in the deck.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. By using cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of Ranger-Captain of Eos and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional card advantage and versatility, while cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm help control the board and protect your creatures. Additionally, the mana base is optimized for consistent and efficient casting of spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. It also utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos to pump up its creatures and maintain board control. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault, while using cards like Static Prison and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to disrupt their strategy. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle and provide the necessary colors for the spells and abilities in the deck.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. By playing low-cost aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional value and resilience to the deck, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Goblin Bombardment offer alternate win conditions. Static Prison and Arena of Glory help control the board and protect your creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to continuously loop through cards in the graveyard, grinding out value and setting up a powerful combo finish. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble help fill the grave while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga provide card advantage and additional resources. The combo finish can be achieved through various means like Thassa's Oracle or Grinding Station. The deck aims to efficiently churn through the deck, assemble the combo pieces, and overwhelm the opponent with a lethal sequence of plays.

The deck utilizes the powerful interaction between Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to create a loop that allows for repeated casting of spells from the graveyard. By utilizing cards like Grinding Station and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and card advantage, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly in order to win the game through a massive storm turn or by using Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student's ability to dig for Thassa's Oracle and win on the spot. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Lightning Bolt, Swan Song, and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Underworld Breach along with a variety of cheap artifacts and mana sources to achieve a quick win. Emry, Lurker of the Loch is a key card that can continuously recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal provide additional card draw and mana ramp. By using cards like Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to assemble a lethal combination that can deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn, often leading to a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Broodscale Bloodchief combo, which involves utilizing Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate a loop of sacrificing creatures and generating mana with Urza's Saga to cast powerful spells like Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck includes support cards like Walking Ballista and Blade of the Bloodchief to help with the combo, as well as disruption cards like Pithing Needle and Soul-Guide Lantern to control the board. The deck also includes ramp and card draw spells to ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The deck focuses on creating a toolbox of creatures that can be searched and brought onto the battlefield at the right moment to enact a powerful combo. It utilizes cards like Cauldron Familiar, Gilded Goose, and Viscera Seer to generate value and set up win conditions. With cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for specific creatures, and Birthing Ritual to ramp up mana, the deck aims to have a variety of options available to achieve victory through synergistic interactions between its creatures.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Tidehollow Sculler to strip critical cards from opponents' hands, while utilizing Aether Vial to cheat out creatures quickly, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plan and push damage through. With a mix of removal spells, disruptive creatures, and efficient beaters like Solitude and Phelia, this deck aims to outpace opponents and control the game's pace to secure a victory.

The core strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. With a suite of counterspells, hand disruption spells, and removal, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's threats and prevent them from executing their strategies effectively. The deck also includes card draw and filtering to ensure consistency and access to key cards. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue the opponent by staying ahead on resources and controlling the game until victory can be achieved.

This control deck focuses on ramping up mana with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and World Breaker. Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator help control the opponent's plays, while Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return deal with creatures on the board. The deck also includes some land destruction with Ghost Quarter and Bojuka Bog to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big, hard-to-handle threats while controlling the battlefield.

This deck focuses on ramping up your mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. Utilizing Karn, the Great Creator and Kozilek's Command, you can control the board and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return provide additional removal options while Devourer of Destiny and Writhing Chrysalis offer more creature-based threats. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with massive creatures and powerful spells, ultimately leading to victory through sheer dominance on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Return and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and the ability to tutor for artifacts. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures while controlling the board and resources through a combination of ramp and control spells.

This Modern Control - Eldrazi Ramp deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes cards like Devourer of Destiny and Nulldrifter for additional value and card draw. Karn, the Great Creator provides utility by fetching artifacts from the sideboard, while Ugin's Labyrinth and Malevolent Rumble help control the board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats while disrupting their strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to equip a Colossus Hammer onto a creature and deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn. Utilizing cards like Puresteel Paladin and Stoneforge Mystic to search for and equip the hammer, along with Leyline Axe and Surge of Salvation to pump up the creature's power. The deck also includes cards like Battlefield Improvisation and Urza's Saga to help assemble the combo pieces quickly, while also providing protection and evasion with cards like Shadowspear and Inkmoth Nexus.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful equipment combo using Colossus Hammer and Puresteel Paladin to create a massive threat on the battlefield. The deck focuses on efficiently equipping creatures with powerful artifacts such as Leyline Axe and Nettlecyst to deal huge amounts of damage in a short amount of time. The inclusion of cards like Urza's Saga and Stoneforge Mystic allow for consistent access to important pieces of the combo, while cards like Grafdigger's Cage and Shadowspear provide valuable disruption and utility.

The key concept of this Modern Aggro - Hollow One deck is to fill up your graveyard quickly with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry in order to cheat out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix. Utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, as well as disruptive cards like Dauthi Voidwalker, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and efficient spells. The inclusion of cards like Arena of Glory and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional value and ways to control the board, creating a versatile and powerful aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly building a powerful board presence with Merfolk creatures that benefit from each other's presence, especially Lords of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. It also uses disruptive spells like Flare of Denial and Sink into Stupor to control the opponent's actions while leveraging Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and overwhelm them with a fast, synergistic tribal strategy that can quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's hand and board, while also playing efficient threats like Solitude and Overlord of the Balemurk to close out the game quickly. The deck also has some flicker effects like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate additional value from enter-the-battlefield abilities. By combining disruptive elements with a fast clock, this deck aims to control the game tempo and come out on top.

The main concept of this Aggro-Death And Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Relic of Progenitus, and Solitude, while also applying pressure with fast creatures like Emperor of Bones and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate value and protect key creatures. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also ensuring consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early on and close out with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Ruby Medallion to quickly generate mana and cast a large number of combo spells in a single turn. Cards like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Manamorphose help to further ramp up the mana production, while Past in Flames allows for spells to be recast from the graveyard. The goal is to generate a critical mass of spells to either deal direct damage with a card like Grapeshot or to combo out with cards like Glimpse the Impossible.

This deck focuses on quickly milling your opponent's library using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Glimpse the Unthinkable, and Tasha's Hideous Laughter. The goal is to fill up their graveyard and trigger powerful effects like Archive Trap and Fractured Sanity. Cards like Fatal Push and Surgical Extraction provide disruption and removal while Thought Scour and Visions of Beyond help dig for key pieces. The key strategy is to outpace your opponent by milling them out before they can assemble their game plan, ultimately leading to a win through decking.

The key concept of this UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate massive amounts of mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void, while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing strategies. The deck aims to control the game through powerful removal spells and high-impact threats, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of control and aggression.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to restrict and control the opponent's resources through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck aims to control the game tempo and card advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Lórien Revealed. Additionally, the inclusion of a companion like Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds a unique twist to the deck strategy. This deck is designed to outlast and outmaneuver opponents, ultimately winning through incremental advantages and powerful late-game threats.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By controlling the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Terminus, the goal is to outlast the opponent and win the game through incremental advantage. Combining powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler with efficient spells like Spell Snare and Force of Negation, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and control the pace of the game until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells and removal spells while also generating card advantage with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a win condition that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes some versatile spells such as Orim's Chant and Tune the Narrative to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting the spells needed to control the game and secure a victory.
